content: wildflower fingerless mitts by diane augustin knitting from the heart minnesota yarn shop hop 2025 welcome to the 2025 mn yarn shop hop the theme this year is in the garden these crocheted fingerless mitts are part of the wildflowers theme selected by knitting from the heart we hope you enjoy the pattern and the hop thank you for your incredible generosity in donations for area food shelves materials one skein 138 yards/125 grams aran weight 100% superwash merino by trippin with dixie signature yarn for knitting from the heart for the minnesota yarn shop hop size h 8 5mm crochet hook locking stitch markers yarn needle abbreviations pattern notes blo back loop only pattern will begin with a strip of ribbing at the wrist after joining the last row bor beginning of round to the first stitches are picked up around the top edge of the ribbing chain chain the mitts are crocheted in a spiral keep track of the beginning of the rounds by double_crochet double_crochet placing a locking stitch marker into the first stitch of the first round and moving eor end of round it into the first stitch of each subsequent round exsc extended single_crochet insert hook into increases for the thumb gusset are made on each side of the marker stitch pull up a loop yo pull through one loop yo size 7 in circumference at the wrist and hand 8 in length from wrist edge to pull through two loops finger edge gauge is 3 sts /in and 3 row/in single_crochet single_crochet directions skip skip leaving an 8 tail ch6 stitches five stitches will be worked for ribbing skip slip_stitch slip_stitch first chain and single_crochet into top loop of next five chain stitches ch1 turn *sc1 into the blo of each stitch ch1 turn repeat from * until there are 11 ridges or 22 row join the ribbing strip into a circle with slip stitches connecting the last row to the beginning chain stitches connect hand to ribbing round 1 place locking stitch marker into the first stitch as you pick up and sc22 stitches in the round two stitches are picked up in between each v at the top of the ribbing there will be 22 stitches rounds 2-4 exsc to eor remember to replace the marker every round increase for thumb round 1 remove marker exsc1 replace marker exsc to one stitch before marker exsc2 stitches into next stitch for increase rounds 2-4 remove marker exsc1 replace marker exsc2 into next stitch for increase exsc to one stitch before marker exsc2 into next stitch for increase round 5 remove marker exsc1 replace marker exsc2 into next stitch for increase exsc to marker continue to replace marker as rounds are worked you will have increased 8 stitches for a total of 30 stitches rounds 6-8 exsc to eor set up for round 9 starting at bor count back five sts and place a marker there will be 4 sts between the new marker
